alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 12:16AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway U, Flat Creek at Highway C and Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Exeter, Butterfield, Mcdowell, Jenkins and Wayne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
